channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report E-2023060360
item.description:
Report E-2023060360

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 30, 2023, two (2) 5-gallon pails containing UN098 were damaged during transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement underneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ancon Services (AS) to remediate the site. AS personnel deployed clay absorbents to the impacted area and swept them in with hand tools. All debris was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented open-top poly drum. All liquid was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented closed-top poly drum. All containers were staged onsite.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package discovered by package handler during process of unloading truck. Production manager notified QA. DescribePack: Inner bottle with loose cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA wearing facial mask and latex gloves gathered spilled contents placed in plastic line hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023060505
item.description:
Report X-2023060505

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-30
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler discovered leaking hazmat and notified manager. Manager then notified QA. DescribePack: Cap for one glass 4 liter jug cracked. Center of the cap broken causing a puncture in the inner seal of the jug. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Ops Admin retrieved the package, placed in hazmat lined tote wearing latex gloves.

item.title: Report E-2023060107
item.description:
Report E-2023060107

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-25
  • City: AMARGOSA VALLEY
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: NRC ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our driver had just stopped at the Longstreet Inn hotel for the night, when he was conducting his post-trip inspection of the vehicle he observed a liquid leak on the ground near the front of the trailer. He entered the trailer and was able to locate a drum that had split and was leaking near the bottom of the drum. He was able to stop the leak by ensuring the bungs were tight and tipping the drum on its side and applying a patch until the response crew was able to place the drum into a salvage drum (overpack).

DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was place in hazmat bag place into red hazmat tote and contained and store inside the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023051410
item.description:
Report X-2023051410

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-27
  • City: RENO
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On May 26th, the package was discovered leaking. There was no shippers declaration attached to the shipment, however the outer packaging did include a DG label, UN number and proper shipping name, UN1760 Corrosive Liquid, n.o.s.(Sodium Hydroxide), 8. The package was contained in salvage packaging and the shipper was contacted for a shippers declaration in order to send on to the consignee.

item.title: Report X-2023051073
item.description:
Report X-2023051073

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-12
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package releasing contents in linehaul trailer. 1 plastic gallon bottle of antimicrobial oxidizer leaking from large crack on side of container. Appears to have sustained crushing force and broken in transit. Item removed from trailer, trailer pulled from door to prevent further employee contact with contents or fumes. DescribePack: Side of plastic bottle cracked open. Crack covers full side of bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package removed from trailer, placed in hazardous materials segregation area under fume hood within spill tote. Trailer where package leaked pulled from door.

item.title: Report X-2023050088
item.description:
Report X-2023050088

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-07T18:12:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-03
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 5/3/2023 at approximately 0945, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4472417, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods shipment, which consisted of one fiberboard box, filled with several COVID-19 tests that appear to be used. The shipment was discovered open druing unloading due in part to the use of masking tape, which is an improper closure. Although there was no release of DG, the shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, having shipped without markings, labeling, packaging. The shipment is bieng held, pending an FAA investigation.
